info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 1:42PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 142 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jerome State Historic Park, or 17 miles northeast of Prescott Valley, moving north at 5 mph. This storm will cause hazardous driving conditions along State Highway 89A.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Clarkdale, Jerome State Historic Park, Woodchute Mountain, Cottonwood Airport, Cottonwood, Verde Village, Jerome, Mingus Mountain, Tuzigoot National Monument and Dead Horse Ranch State Park.
This includes State Route 89A between mile markers 332 and 352.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Potato Patch Campground, Playground Group Campground, Potato Patch Campground, Red-Tail Hawk Loop Campground, Quail Loop Campground, Raven Loop Campground, Blackhawk Loop Campground and Cooper's Hawk Loop Campground.
info.instruction: Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM IMPACTING STATE HIGHWAY 89A WEST OF CLARKDALE UNTIL 215 PM MST

area.areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons
